posts.post_content:
While I like the idea of slapping together [Silence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silence) and [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) onto one card, it really just doesn't work most of the time, especially in today's standard. Here's how I generally see this spell go at my local tourney:  
  
Player 1: I play this really big spell that cost up all of my mana pool this turn  
Player 2: I Render Silent! Now you can't play anymore spells this turn, despite having no more mana to do so!
posts.html:

Player 2: I Render Silent! Now you can't play anymore spells this turn, despite having no more mana to do so!

Posted By: TheWaddleDeeKing (7/2/2013 11:08:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
When you think about it, there really aren't /that/ many circumstances in which this is better than both [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) AND [Silence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silence). Early game you'll usually just be using this as a more expensive Counterspell. Late-game you might screw someone over by getting rid of a card from their plan (aka same as Counterspell) or you might stall a turn (aka same as Silence) but only rarely will both effects be needed.  
  
Think of this as Silence+opponent discards 1. There are some situations where this is better (opponent has cards to play on your turn or activated abilities requiring mana but not the mana required to do them and cast something) but a lot of the time the {U}{U} will just add on an inverse cantrip, which is good but not great in terms of mana-efficiency.  
  
tl;dr pretty niche card and I wouldn't mainboard this over Counterspell OR Silence.
posts.html:
When you think about it, there really aren't /that/ many circumstances in which this is better than both Counterspell AND Silence. Early game you'll usually just be using this as a more expensive Counterspell. Late-game you might screw someone over by getting rid of a card from their plan (aka same as Counterspell) or you might stall a turn (aka same as Silence) but only rarely will both effects be needed.

Think of this as Silence+opponent discards 1. There are some situations where this is better (opponent has cards to play on your turn or activated abilities requiring mana but not the mana required to do them and cast something) but a lot of the time the {U}{U} will just add on an inverse cantrip, which is good but not great in terms of mana-efficiency.

tl;dr pretty niche card and I wouldn't mainboard this over Counterspell OR Silence.

posts.post_content:
This card just inspired me to build a silent deck. Put 4 X [Silence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silence), 4 X [Render Silent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Render Silent), 4X[Grand Abolisher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grand Abolisher) ....   
  
With this card, you pretty much paid only 2 for counterspell like [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) and pay another one mana for [Silence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silence) but you also save number of cards in your hand.   
  
Very strong card.... 5/5
